image.altText: A woman wearing a pink checkered bandana sits on a red sofa in window light beneath a plant and lamp.

props.synopsis: For more than four decades, The Hobart Clinic has provided private mental health services to clients. Since the announcement of its October closure, clinic staff, therapists and patients have warned of the negative impact on those reliant on the service.

title.children: Therapists, patients raise concerns over the October closure of The Hobart Clinic

image.altText: a man in a Huon/ JBS jacket

props.synopsis: Huon Aquaculture's new chief executive officer has described the upcoming review of Tasmania's salmon industry as "unnecessary", saying that a pause on expansion would not stop the company's plans.

title.children: New salmon boss says government misled before calling review

image.altText: A woman wearing a high vis vest smiles into the camera whilst standing in front of a construciton site.

props.synopsis: The agency behind Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium build says it is undeterred by the three key issues raised by the recent planning commission's final report, arguing it comes down to "priorities".

title.children: Stadium report findings are 'matters of opinion and choice', proponent says

image.altText: Hard of hearing, expert on cochlear

props.synopsis: Around one-in-six Tasmanians has some form of hearing loss, and that number gets higher the older you get. Our parliamentary speaker is deaf and says her cochlear implant has changed her life.

title.children: TassieCast: Parliament's speaker is deaf, like many Tasmanians

image.altText: David Jenkins

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian court hears a man left a voice message "minutes" after an alleged murder, saying he had just seen a person stabbed multiple times.

title.children: Murder co-accused left voice message 'minutes' after victim stabbed, court hears

image.altText: A tail of a Qantas plane is seen on the runway at Sydney Airport, Sydney,

props.synopsis: There are concerns the decision could impact regional flights, as staff would have to travel from Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane to get to work.

title.children: Qantas may close staff bases in Hobart, Mildura and Canberra

image.altText: A black and white photo of woman in a nurse uniform holding a 1930s telephone receiver to the ear of a man.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Joan Marion became a star of the screen and stage abroad; her granddaughter says she maintained a connection to Launceston for much of her life.

title.children: Actress Joan Marion never returned to Tasmania but loved it from afar

image.altText: Two men walk along the walls of a canal filled with debris

props.synopsis: Unexpected and deadly flooding rocked Bali last week, at a scale many had never experienced before. In the wake of this disaster, the search has begun for answers.

title.children: After deadly floods in Bali, its people want answers. Many are blaming overtourism

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel waving while wearing a suit on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: Prominent leaders in the Democratic Party are accusing the US's communications regulator of "bullying" a network to take the long-running late night show off air.

title.children: Trump berates suspended Kimmel, Democrats lash regulator 'bullying'

image.altText: A fisherman casts his rod as storm clouds pass over Botany Bay in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australia's key drivers of weather variability are stacking up to produce another wet, severe-weather season, with an increased risk of flooding, thunderstorms and cyclones.

title.children: Surprise La Niña hints at another wet and stormy Australian summer

image.altText: Vladimir Putin stands near a pile of drones at a drone factory among other men in suits.

props.synopsis: Ukraine is struggling to defend against growing drone attacks, and with Russia's mass production factories in full-swing there are fears thousands will soon be launched in a single night.

title.children: Hundreds of drones swarm Ukraine nightly. Soon there could be thousands

image.altText: A man walks at a barrier, at the Allenby Bridge Crossing between the West Bank and Jordan

props.synopsis: In a statement, the IDF said a person "arrived in a truck transporting humanitarian aid from Jordan, and opened fire".

title.children: Two dead after shooting at West Bank-Jordan border crossing

image.altText: Gout Gout walks in a stadium

props.synopsis: Gout Gout's promise and progress are on full display at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by showing patience, he could get even better.

title.children: 'I have time': Gout Gout's patience an impressive virtue

image.altText: A woman and a man, faces unseen, sit side by side while holding a photograph.

props.synopsis: Steven Callanan had the world at his feet and loved footy like it was a religion. The talented player could bring together communities while he played, but after a night of partying he took his own life.

title.children: Shattered parents call for change after 21-year-old footy star's death

image.altText: A police officer sprays a protestor's face with tear gas

props.synopsis: The CGT trade union claims more than a million people took part in demonstrations, while police say more than 90 people have been detained.

title.children: Nationwide protests erupt in France over Macron's austerity policies

image.altText: A Queenslander style house undergoing renovation.

props.synopsis: Property experts say a "dizzying" report forecasting the impacts of worsening climate conditions on Australian properties has sounded a clear warning for the sector.

title.children: Future proofing old homes a 'key challenge' amid climate threat

image.altText: Close up image of a concrete kerb and open drain on a suburban street

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who emptied drums containing hazardous chemicals into a suburban gutter — causing nearby residents to experience headaches and nausea — has been fined thousands of dollars.

title.children: Man fined for pouring 'volatile' chemicals into suburban gutter

image.altText: Drug testing taking place at a clinic equipped with syringes, computers and scales.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has been unrepentant in its tough stance on drugs, with Health Minister Tim Nicholls telling state parliament this week it doesn't "support drug dealers", writes Janelle Miles.

title.children: Bitter pill handed to Queensland's stalled drug checking services

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel announced his son had open heart surgery

props.synopsis: Emmys watchers could assume there's never been a better time in Hollywood to hold its most powerful to account, but Jimmy Kimmel's axing proves otherwise.

title.children: Hollywood is acutely aware the death of late-night TV is near

image.altText: Mother paints face of daughter who has childhood dementia

props.synopsis: Rachel Anderson says she knew something was not right when her daughter Hannah began struggling to remember things she had just done.

title.children: Family grapples with 12yo's devastating childhood dementia diagnosis

image.altText: Albania AI minister

props.synopsis: The world's first AI government minister was appointed last week by Albania's prime minister to oversee decisions on public tenders and to ease voter concerns about corruption.

title.children: AI-generated minister addresses Albanian parliament for first time

image.altText: A large yellow plane with red letters 'DHL' sits on tarmac

props.synopsis: British and Lithuanian authorities have detained people on suspicion of carrying out intelligence-related activities on behalf of Russia

title.children: UK and Lithuania arrest alleged Russian spies

image.altText: Victor Radley looks ahead during a Sydney Roosters' NRL match.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters suspend Victor Radley for 10 matches without pay following media revelations he allegedly requested an illegal substance from former teammate Brandon Smith.

title.children: Roosters hand Radley 'heaviest sanction' in club's history

image.altText: Queen Camilla, King Charles, Donald and Melanie Trump standing in formal wear and smiling on a red carpet

props.synopsis: Surrounded by high-level politicians, a media mogul, tech giants and athletes, the grandeur-loving US president was treated to a glowing spectacle at Windsor Castle.

title.children: Donald Trump's historic banquet dinner visit in pictures

image.altText: TV host Paul Burt smiles as he holds up a trout with a lake in the background.

props.synopsis: An exchange about domestic violence between 'Bush Cook Ranger Nick' and the host of Step Outside with Paul Burt, broadcast on 7mate, was in breach of classification rules, the watchdog has found.

title.children: 'Disturbing' domestic violence comments aired on fishing show

image.altText: Brittany Higgins looks at the right.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins lodges an appeal against a WA Supreme Court judgement that she defamed her former boss and ex-Liberal senator Linda Reynolds in social media posts.

title.children: Brittany Higgins files last-day appeal over Linda Reynolds defamation ruling

image.altText: Photo illustration shows a downward trending line chart with emissions from a fossil fuel plant and a forest on either side.

props.synopsis: After much anticipation, Australia has its new climate targets. Now that the dice have fallen, we consult experts on their assessment of how these targets stack up with what’s at stake.

title.children: Climate experts cast their verdict of Australia's 2035 targets

image.altText: Matt Kean, Anthony Albanese and Chris Bowen behind a lecturn.

props.synopsis: The government is keenly aware that the cost of the transition is a sensitive issue, which is why the prime minister was flanked not just by his climate minister but also his treasurer.

title.children: The live wire buried under the 2035 target Albanese didn't dare touch

image.altText: Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell in A Big Bold Beautiful Journey

props.synopsis: Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell tell News Breakfast that 'the best part' of working on their new movie A Big Bold Beautiful Journey was each other.

title.children: Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell bond over Aussie 'delicacy'

image.altText: Julie Bishop looks serious at a press conference.

props.synopsis: ANU chancellor Julie Bishop provides a formal written response "categorically" denying allegations of bullying, harassment and hostile behaviour, levelled against her during a Senate committee hearing last month.

title.children: ANU chancellor Julie Bishop formally responds to bullying allegations

image.altText: PROXY - Indigenous flags

props.synopsis: First Nations leaders have endorsed plans for a new national representative body to be established. Here’s what we know.

title.children: 'New national entity' divides First Nations delegates at National Gathering

image.altText: A floral tribute on the side of the road, with a 60km speed limit sign in the background.

props.synopsis: The family of an Aboriginal man killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out about the sentence handed to the man who killed him, and the "racist, dehumanising" messages he sent afterwards.

title.children: Family of Aboriginal hit-and-run victim voice 'disgust' over offender texts

image.altText: pope leo stands above a crowd of worshippers and gives them a thumbs up gesture

props.synopsis: Pope Leo says he recognises the influence of the United States on world affairs but makes clear he is not a supporter of US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Pope Leo says he has no intention of getting involved in US politics

image.altText: A man uses a squeegee and soapy water to clean a window

props.synopsis: Windows and fly screens are often the first things we see when we walk into a home, but rarely at the top of the spring-cleaning to-do list. Experts share their tips on the easiest and most effective ways to clean them.

title.children: The easiest and most effective ways to clean windows and fly screens
